title: Phrack Pro-Phile: Lex Luthor
historical_context: This interview with Lex Luthor, a prominent figure in the hacking community and founder of the Legion of Doom, provides insights into the mindset and motivations of early hackers during a time when hacking was becoming more mainstream and controversial.
target_audience: Hackers, security professionals, and those interested in hacker culture history.
short_summary: This article features an in-depth interview with Lex Luthor, a legendary hacker and founder of the Legion of Doom. He discusses his motivations for hacking, the importance of information, and his experiences within the hacking community, while reflecting on the evolution of hacking culture.
summary:
In this engaging interview, Taran King converses with Lex Luthor, who shares his journey into the world of hacking and phreaking. Lex recounts how his fascination with computers began with a friend's Apple and the allure of information drove him to explore the depths of hacking. He emphasizes that the pursuit of information was paramount, often overshadowing the desire for notoriety. Lex reflects on the importance of being cautious and the paranoia that often accompanies the hacking lifestyle, attributing his success in avoiding legal troubles to secrecy and misdirection. He also discusses the evolution of the hacking community, the rise of security measures, and the challenges faced by hackers in a rapidly changing technological landscape.

Lex's insights extend beyond personal anecdotes; he critiques the obsession with tracking individuals within the hacking community and advocates for a more constructive approach to information sharing. He concludes with a cautionary note about the future of hacking, suggesting that while new technologies will emerge, the risks of detection will continue to increase. This interview serves as a historical snapshot of the hacker ethos during a pivotal time in the evolution of computer security and hacker culture.
